sentences.spanish: Cuando yo tenía seis años, vi en un libro sobre la selva virgen que se titulaba Historias vividas, una magnífica lámina.
sentences.english: When I was six years old, I saw a magnificent illustration in a book about the virgin jungle entitled True Stories.

sentences.spanish: Representaba una serpiente boa que se tragaba a una fiera.
sentences.english: It depicted a boa constrictor swallowing a wild animal.

sentences.spanish: Ésta es la copia del dibujo.
sentences.english: This is a copy of the drawing.

sentences.spanish: En el libro se afirmaba: «La serpiente boa se traga su presa entera, sin masticarla.
sentences.english: The book stated: "The boa constrictor swallows its prey whole, without chewing it."

sentences.spanish: Luego ya no puede moverse y duerme durante los seis meses que dura su digestión».
sentences.english: Then he can no longer move and sleeps for the six months it takes for his digestion to take."

sentences.spanish: Reflexioné mucho en ese momento sobre las aventuras de la jungla y a mi vez logré trazar con un lápiz de colores mi primer dibujo.
sentences.english: I reflected a lot at that moment on the adventures of the jungle and in turn I managed to draw my first picture with a colored pencil.

sentences.spanish: Mi dibujo número 1 era de esta manera: Enseñé mi obra de arte a las personas mayores y les pregunté si mi dibujo les daba miedo. —¿Por qué habría de asustar un sombrero? —me respondieron.
sentences.english: My first drawing looked like this: I showed my artwork to the grown-ups and asked them if my drawing frightened them. "Why should a hat be frightening?" they replied.

sentences.spanish: Mi dibujo no representaba un sombrero.
sentences.english: My drawing did not depict a hat.

sentences.spanish: Representaba una serpiente boa que digiere un elefante.
sentences.english: It depicted a boa constrictor digesting an elephant.

sentences.spanish: Dibujé entonces el interior de la serpiente boa a fin de que las personas mayores pudieran comprender.
sentences.english: I then drew the inside of the boa snake so that older people could understand.

sentences.spanish: Siempre estas personas tienen necesidad de explicaciones.
sentences.english: These people always need explanations.

sentences.spanish: Mi dibujo número 2 era así: Las personas mayores me aconsejaron abandonar el dibujo de serpientes boas, ya fueran abiertas o cerradas, y poner más interés en la geografía, la historia, el cálculo y la gramática.
sentences.english: My second drawing looked like this: Grown-ups advised me to give up drawing boa constrictors, whether open or closed, and to take more interest in geography, history, arithmetic, and grammar.

sentences.spanish: De esta manera a la edad de seis años abandoné una magnífica carrera de pintor.
sentences.english: Thus, at the age of six, I abandoned a magnificent career as a painter.

sentences.spanish: Había quedado desilusionado por el fracaso de mis dibujos número 1 y número 2.
sentences.english: I had been disappointed by the failure of my drawings number 1 and number 2.

sentences.spanish: Las personas mayores nunca pueden comprender algo por sí solas y es muy aburrido para los niños tener que darles una y otra vez explicaciones.
sentences.english: Older people can never understand anything on their own, and it is very boring for children to have to give them explanations over and over again.

sentences.spanish: Tuve, pues, que elegir otro oficio y aprendí a pilotar aviones.
sentences.english: So I had to choose another profession and I learned to fly airplanes.

sentences.spanish: He volado un poco por todo el mundo y la geografía, en efecto, me ha servido de mucho; al primer vistazo podía distinguir perfectamente la China de Arizona.
sentences.english: I've flown around the world a bit and geography has indeed been very useful to me; at first glance I could perfectly distinguish China from Arizona.

sentences.spanish: Esto es muy útil, sobre todo si se pierde uno durante la noche.
sentences.english: This is very useful, especially if you get lost during the night.

sentences.spanish: A lo largo de mi vida he tenido multitud de contactos con multitud de gente seria.
sentences.english: Throughout my life I have had many contacts with many serious people.

sentences.spanish: Viví mucho con personas mayores y las he conocido muy de cerca; pero esto no ha mejorado demasiado mi opinión sobre ellas.
sentences.english: I lived with older people for a long time and got to know them very well; but this hasn't improved my opinion of them much.

sentences.spanish: Cuando me he encontrado con alguien que me parecía un poco lúcido, lo he sometido a la experiencia de mi dibujo número 1 que he conservado siempre.
sentences.english: When I have encountered someone who seemed a little lucid, I have subjected them to the experience of my drawing number 1, which I have always kept.

sentences.spanish: Quería saber si verdaderamente era un ser comprensivo.
sentences.english: I wanted to know if he was truly an understanding being.

sentences.spanish: E invariablemente me contestaban siempre: «Es un sombrero».
sentences.english: And they invariably answered me: "It's a hat."

sentences.spanish: Me abstenía de hablarles de la serpiente boa, de la selva virgen y de las estrellas.
sentences.english: I refrained from telling them about the boa constrictor, the virgin jungle, and the stars.

sentences.spanish: Poniéndome a su altura, les hablaba del bridge, del golf, de política y de corbatas.
sentences.english: Getting down to their level, I talked to them about bridge, golf, politics, and ties.

sentences.spanish: Y mi interlocutor se quedaba muy contento de conocer a un hombre tan razonable.
sentences.english: And my interlocutor was very pleased to meet such a reasonable man.
